comments:
Build: 20020502

The only possibility is that the buffer factory returns null. This is not 
specified as being a valid value. 

Kai do you want us to change the spec to allow the buffer factory to return 
null? In this case the default buffer factory would be used.

Or is this bug a symptom of a problem with the JDT/UI component?
Please move back to jdt/core if you need the API to be changed.

Will no longer return null. Build F2. However, there must have been a 
CoreException in between or the BufferFactory has been called for an element 
that is no longer managed. The last situation should never happens.

Not able to verify. No test case. 

Closing
